Authors:
Lei Ye, Samantha Karunarathna, Huili Li, Dhanushka
Nadeeshan Wanasinghe, ITTHAYAKORN PROMPUTTHA, Jian-Chu Xu, Kevin D Hyde,
Peter E Mortimer
Title:
New tropical species of Lycoperdon subgenus Morganella
(Agaricales, Basidiomycota) from Yunnan Province, China
Abstract:
Five specimens of Lycoperdon were collected during surveys
conducted in the evergreen broadleaf forests of Xishuangbanna, Yunnan
Province, China. Macro- and micro- characteristics, together with
analysis of combined ITS and LSU sequence data, showed that the
specimens all belong to a single new species. The new species is
distinguished from the remaining taxa in Lycoperdon by its greyish white
to dark grey exoperidium covered by minute and blackish grey granules,
smooth to wrinkled endoperidium, non-chambered subgleba and echinate
basidiospores with a short pedicel. Lycoperdon and its intergeneric
classification are poorly understood due to the overlap of morphological
characters in subgenera and lack of DNA sequence data to infer
phylogenetic relationships. The main objective of the present paper is
to introduce a novel species, Lycoperdon mengsongensis. We also fill the
gap of the current knowledge on the phylogenetic position of Morganella
in Lycoperdon. Comprehensive morphological descriptions, color
photographs of macro- and micro- characteristics and a phylogenetic tree
are provided to show the placement of the new species. In addition, the
new species is compared with closely related taxa in Lycoperdon subgenus
Morganella
